course.subject: IELM
course.name: Industrial Data Systems
course.description: Fundamental concepts on database, network, object-oriented methodology, and system integration; design and development of database systems for productions (e.g. MRP), manufacturing (e.g. CAPP), and management (e.g. BPR).
course.prerequisites: COMP 1002 (prior to 2012-13) OR COMP 1004 (prior to 2012-13) OR COMP 1021 OR COMP 1022P OR COMP 1022Q
course.exclusions: COMP 3311, ISOM 3260

reviews.author: Nopopo
reviews.title: Good Prof.
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture Outline:
1- Introduction to Database.
2- Conceptual Data Model: ER Model.
3- Relational Model.
4- Mapping ER to Relational Model.
5- Relational Algebra.
6- Basic SQL.
7- Advanced SQL.
8- Design Theory: Normalization up to 3NF.

Lab Outline:
1- HTML.
2- PHP.
3- SQL.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof.Qi explained all the concepts clearly and provide a lot of example so that students could easily get the basic concept during each lecture. She also gave midterm review and final exam review. These review were really helpful for student to get higher marks. SQL tutorials were helpful, highly recommend to attend all the tutorial.
reviews.comment_grading:
No points deducted for no attendance to lecture.
Bonus: 3.5/4
Midterm Exam:    96/100
Final Exam grade was not published
Final grade : A
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair. All homework could be referred to lecture note.

reviews.author: whoDis
reviews.title: IELM 3300
reviews.comment_content:
Book Recommended (Not needed really): Fundamentals of Database Systems by Ramez Elmasri

Lecture Outline:
1- Introduction to Database.
2- Conceptual Data Model: ER Model.
3- Relational Model.
4- Mapping ER to Relational Model.
5- Relational Algebra.
6- Basic SQL.
7- Advanced SQL.
8- Design Theory: Normalization up to 3NF.

Lab Outline:
1- HTML.
2- PHP.
3- SQL.
reviews.comment_teaching: I only attended the first 2-3 lectures. Prof. Qi nicely explained concepts and answered questions. Her English is comprehensible, but she talks slowly. She also replied to every question I sent her through email quite quickly
reviews.comment_grading:
No points deducted for no attendance to lecture. The grading curve is very lenient. I did not attend 1 Lab, did not submit 1 assignment, and submitted another assignment 1 day late, but in the end still got an A!

Labs                  9 x 2%
Assignments     4 x 3% (Assignment #5 does not count towards your grade. Also, Prof. Qi uses a 1% penalty/day late policy)
Midterm Exam     30% (HTML & PHP are tested)
Final Exam           40% (Cumulative lecture material, non-cumulative lab material)  
Bonus 4% (you can earn 0.5% per lecture by answering any of the questions she asks)

Personally:
Labs:           16/18       
Bonus: 0/4
Assignment #1:  90/100
Assignment #2:  0/100
Assignment #3:  94.5/100
Assignment #4:  64/100
Midterm Exam:    91/100
Final Exam grade is not published

Final Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair. You can answer the assignments by only going thru the slides. To prepare for the exams, going thru canvas materials will suffice.

reviews.author: olivercck
reviews.title: ielm3300
reviews.comment_content: some sql computer statement, if you have studied computer in secondary school, you will take advantage in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: qi qi's teaching style is quite good and clear, there are some marks of class participation. just need to raise up your hand and answer one question then you can get bonus marks.
reviews.comment_grading: quite good, it is very easy to do the er model and relational model in the midterm
reviews.comment_workload: low just need to hand in 4-5 assignment and do the lab on time and u can get a large proportion of the marks

reviews.author: Finger_ha
reviews.title: A fair course, not too difficult but needs time to understand the whole thing
reviews.comment_content:
1.  Evaluate the rationale for the storage and use of large scale data and describe the associ-ated challenges and difficulties.
2.  Translate unorganized textual data requirements into Entity-Relationship models.
3.  Describe the purpose and techniques for normalization
4.  Convert a given ER diagram informally into relational schema design
5.  Use concepts of functional dependencies to generate 3NF and BCNF schema designs.
6.  Use operations on relational tables using Relational Algebra.
7.  Create a database in SQL and create tables in the database.
8.  Write and run a SQL query in a database.
9.  Explain the basics of Client-Server architecture in software systems.
10.  Use PHP language to write server-side CGI programs interfaced with a database server.
11.  Design and develop a software application using the Web-server as the DB-client model.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Qi is friendly, also for the TAs, willing to help and answer questions.

Lesson was not too boring, examples are demonstrated.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm (30%)
homework (12%) 5 in total, 4 will be graded
labs (18%) 9 labs in total (1 point for attendance + 1 point for finishing the lab)
final (40%)
Bonus mark for answering questions during lectures (max. 4%)

The exams are closed.  No books, no notes.
Mean is around C+
Not too difficult to get a C range, but getting a B or above does require some effort and time.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too tough, 5 assignments in total, 4 will be graded, for labs, 9 in total, (actually 8, the last one is usually a final review session, and whether you come or not, you will get the 2% for that lab)

If you are interested in and having background with things like ER diagram, 3NF and BCNF schema designs, Relational Algebra, SQL and PHP, it is going to be a easy course for you.

If not, it might be a touch one for you.

reviews.author: Michael Sum
reviews.comment_content: Interesting content regarding the whole system of database. It focuses on database management, which allows students to learn more about what's a database and how you can manage them, and apply those skills into real life situation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is quite normal, with clear ideas and contents in the slides. It's quite easy to catch up and she provides examples and exercises throughout the whole semester.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is good, most of my friends got a B-range, when they just above mean. I will say this is a good-grade course.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload isn't too much, 8 lab sections for this semester and 4 assignments in total. So it's kind of a low-workload course.

reviews.author: legendarychriz
reviews.title: A course which is rather close to COMP
reviews.comment_content:
I never think of database is related to IELM.
This course is strongly related to COMP courses, if you guys have good grades in COMP 1021,1022P/Q, then you will find this easy.

For computer idiots like me, this will be a nightmare, and most people tend to have better grades since they think it is 'easy'.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is rather good, examples are explained clearly, and there are also enough time for us to think about the logic.

She also encourages students to answer questions, and if you do it, you will get 0.5 bonus point for 1 lecture (capped at 4). No matter you answered correct or wrong she will still let you have the bonus point.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: 17/30 mean:21/30
Final not sure but I guess I will below mean about 0.5 to 1 S.D.
Finally got C+
Actually that is fair as I have same difficulties met in COMP1022P (you can see my review, and being agreed by most people).
That is quite fair as I don't understand all of the concepts.
reviews.comment_workload:
It is relatively low for this course.
4/5 homework is being graded throughout the semester.
Labs are also easy if you just follow what TA says.

reviews.author: VCJ
reviews.title: Industrial Data Systems
reviews.comment_content:
Lecture:
Conceptual Data Model (ER Model). Relational Mode, ER to relational mapping, relational algebra, SQL, Design theory (normalization, 1NF, 2NF, 3NF)
Lab:
HTTP, PHP, SQL

Easy but not practical enough
reviews.comment_teaching: Responsive professor and TAs, just the content is too fundamental that nothing to ask for
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 12% (mean ~83, only 4 out of 5 homework will be graded)
Lab 18% (full mark as long as you can finish it on time)
Midterm 30%  (mean ~78, must review lab content!!!)
Final 40% (cumulative, no HTTP/PHP for final)
Bonus 4% (0.5% for answering each question on lecture)
Easy A, >95% overall for A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Low
Homework x5 (Generally easy, except HW4)
Labs x9 (normally finished in 1.5 hour)
1 mid term
1 Final
No attendance required
